revised_title: Infectious Pathways of Trypanosoma Pecorum in Antelopes
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the transmission and pathogenicity of Trypanosoma pecorum in antelopes. They discovered that antelopes can act as reservoirs for the trypanosome, which causes a rapidly fatal disease in cattle and domestic animals. The author found that laboratory-bred flies were not efficient carriers of the trypanosome, but antelopes could harbor the parasite for at least 323 days without showing any harm to the host.
